subject: RE: [junit] Testing abstract class implementations
msgSnippet: Of course, in reality, I messed up my code for FooSpecialTest. The idea of subclassing (either strategy) works. Once I fixed my typo, it worked exactly as
messageBody:
Of course, in reality, I messed up my code for FooSpecialTest. The idea
of subclassing (either strategy) works. Once I fixed my typo, it worked
exactly as desired. Yay junit!

Regards,

Rob
